gnat.alignment
Class Alignment

java.lang.Object
  gnat.alignment.Alignment
Direct Known Subclasses:
LocalAlignment
public class Alignment
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements the global alignment algorithm by Needleman-Wunsch.

global Alignment: Needleman-Wunsch(1970), Sellers(1974)
local Alignment: Smith-Waterman(1981)

Author:
Conrad Plake, Joerg Hakenberg

protected  java.util.List gapLimitedTraceback(int[][][] pointer, int i, int j, java.util.List<Phrase[]> list, Phrase alignment1, Phrase alignment2, int gapCount, int maxGaps)
          Returns a list of aligned phrases.
 java.util.List getAlignments()
          Returns a list of alignments for two phrases last computed by method align.
The list may contain more than one element, because there may be multiple optimal alignment paths.
Every element in the returned list is an array of phrases with length of two, which contains two aligned phrases.

 SubstitutionMatrix getSubstitutionsmatrix()
          Returns the substitution matrix.
 int[][][] makePointer(float[][] table, Phrase p1, Phrase p2)
          Returns a 3-dim array of integers, denoting pointers between cells in the given table.
Example: pointers from cell (i,j):
LEFT pointer:
i = pointers[i][j][0]
j-1 = pointers[i][j][1]
UP pointer:
i-1 = pointers[i][j][2]
j = pointers[i][j][3]
LEFT/UP pointer:
i-1 = pointers[i][j][4]
j-1 = pointers[i][j][5]

makePointer

public int[][][] makePointer(float[][] table,
                             Phrase p1,
                             Phrase p2)
Returns a 3-dim array of integers, denoting pointers between cells in the given table.
Example: pointers from cell (i,j):
LEFT pointer:
i = pointers[i][j][0]
j-1 = pointers[i][j][1]
UP pointer:
i-1 = pointers[i][j][2]
j = pointers[i][j][3]
LEFT/UP pointer:
i-1 = pointers[i][j][4]
j-1 = pointers[i][j][5]

                   Phrase p2)
Aligns two phrases and returns the maximum score.

alignWithLimitedGaps

public float alignWithLimitedGaps(Phrase p1,
                                  Phrase p2,
                                  int maxGaps)
Aligns two phrases and returns the maximum score.

traceback

protected java.util.List traceback(int[][][] pointer,
                                   int i,
                                   int j,
                                   java.util.List<Phrase[]> list,
                                   Phrase alignment1,
                                   Phrase alignment2)
Returns a list of aligned phrases. All traceback paths are considered by recursively calling this method, whenever a cell on the path points to multiple neighbors.

gapLimitedTraceback

protected java.util.List gapLimitedTraceback(int[][][] pointer,
                                             int i,
                                             int j,
                                             java.util.List<Phrase[]> list,
                                             Phrase alignment1,
                                             Phrase alignment2,
                                             int gapCount,
                                             int maxGaps)
Returns a list of aligned phrases. All traceback paths are considered by recursively calling this method, whenever a cell on the path points to multiple neighbors.

singleTraceback

protected Phrase[] singleTraceback(int[][][] pointer,
                                   int i,
                                   int j)
Returns an array of length two, containing two aligned phrases. Only one traceback path is considered.

gapLimitedSingleTraceback

protected Phrase[] gapLimitedSingleTraceback(int[][][] pointer,
                                             int i,
                                             int j,
                                             int maxGaps)
Returns an array of length two, containing two aligned phrases. Only one traceback path is considered.

printTable

public void printTable(float[][] table)
Prints out values of a given table to the console. Useful for debugging.

printPointer

public void printPointer(int[][][] table)
Prints out values of a given pointer-table (see makePointer) to the console. Useful for debugging.

printPointer

protected void printPointer(int[][][] table,
                            int c1,
                            int c2)
Prints out values of cell c1,c2 of a given pointer-table (see makePointer) to the console. Useful for debugging.

getAlignmentScore

public float getAlignmentScore(Phrase p1,
                               Phrase p2)
Returns the weight or score for the alignment of two phrases.
Unlike in method align, only one traceback path is processed to compute the score.

getGapLimitedAlignmentScore

public java.lang.Float getGapLimitedAlignmentScore(Phrase p1,
                                                   Phrase p2,
                                                   int maxGaps)
Returns the weight or score for the alignment of two phrases.
Unlike in method align, only one traceback path is processed to compute the score.

getScore

public float getScore(Phrase p1,
                      Phrase p2)
Returns the weight or score between to phrases.
The phrases are assumed to be aligned to each other and thus are of equal length and may contain gaps.

getAlignments

public java.util.List getAlignments()
Returns a list of alignments for two phrases last computed by method align.
The list may contain more than one element, because there may be multiple optimal alignment paths.
Every element in the returned list is an array of phrases with length of two, which contains two aligned phrases.
